alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus; Iredell; Mecklenburg; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 7:52PM EDT until June 20 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Cabarrus County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Iredell County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Northwestern Mecklenburg County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Southwestern Rowan County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 145 AM EDT. * At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. One to three inches of rain has fallen over the past two hours on top of 1-2 inches of rain that fell earlier today. Ongoing nuisance to Minor flooding is going to worsen as a result of training thunderstorms. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly and new areas of flooding are likely to develop. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Huntersville, Kannapolis, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson, Landis, Enochville, Ramsey Creek Park, Doolie and Mount Ulla. An additional 1-2 inches of rainfall is possible across the warned area, exacerbating ongoing flooding. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
